title: It's hard to want to keep playing.
body:
So, I main mages and juggernauts, with an (AP) assassin or two sprinkled in there. However, with every patch that comes along, it gets harder and harder to justify playing anything that isn't an AD stacking damage dealer, be that an ADC, a melee ADC, an assassin, or even full AD Darius. I do less damage, I have less survivability, I have less mobility, I have less sustain, I have terrible resource pools (that is getting worse), I have skillshots and CDs... I don't want to play a game where playing the champs I enjoy means I'm gimping myself, but that's about how it is already, with it getting worse every patch.

Then, combine that with the fact that we're ignoring champs who have absurd win and pickrates, ignoring champs who go against everything Riot says they value, making idiotic changes to try and push metas in LC$, and all that... It's no wonder everyone is complaining.

I don't want to quit, since the game underneath all of Tencent's greed is enjoyable, and since I have nothing else to do, but I'm kind of done with supporting a terrible company that doesn't care about the game at all beyond how much money it pulls in. 

I really wish people would just stop throwing money at shitty companies -- maybe EA wouldn't be as bad as it is, maybe Riot would be somewhat decent, maybe Nintendo wouldn't have switched to greed mode immediately after Iwata's death... but, modern "gamers" don't really give a damn about something as inane as quality or passion so long as they have a way to waste time and/or feel superior for being a high rank. I wish whales just stayed in phone gaming.

Riot really needs to understand that they stopped letting the players decide how to play their game when they nerfed lane swapping (among everything else).  We can play Riot's™ way or take the highway.

Nintendo switched to greed mode when? Odyssey and BOTW are two of the best-crafted games to date, and like previous games only require the upfront cost of the gaming console (the switch) and the game itself. The costs of playing the games is relatively similar to the cost of playing Nintendo games before, adjusting for inflation and supply/demand shocks. 

Before anyone tells me "oh but you just listed 2 games out of the hundreds of mediocre ones" wasn't it like that before Iwata's death as well? Nintendo had been on a decline because their popular series (Mario, Zelda/Link, Kirby (ESPECIALLY), Pokemon, Fire Emblem amongst others) seemed to have run out of ideas. BOTW and Odyssey offered a fresh answer - no, those franchises are far from done. I am eagerly looking forward to what Nintendo will do now with Pokemon (especially on the Switch), Fire Emblem (hopefullly they get rid of the children system and look on improving combat) and Kirby. 

Edit: Splatoon 2 has been enjoyable to play too.

BOTW and Odyssey aren't good games though. Relative to other modern trash, sure, they're better than most, but relative to other Nintendo games, especially in their own respective series, they're trash. BOTW is hollow and lifeless, with no story, progression or character development, and Odyssey is Mario without a soul. 

And Iwata hated mobile gaming and DLC with a passion, because he knew they were just about money, and didn't stick to the principles Nintendo had -- that's why Nintendo games never had DLC, and they had no mobile games. As soon as he got sick and left the company, Nintendo went into mobile gaming, and now that he's gone... Nintendo is just as bad as any other company putting out half-assed games riddled with DLC.

oof, you  had a good post until you said BOTW and Odyssey aren't good games. I haven't been around that long, only since Mario 64, but I will say that Odyssey is one of the best Mario games to date. I haven't played BOTW but everyone i know thats played it says it is best zelda game of the 20th century.

Odyssey was supposed to be the Mario game that goes back to the model of 64 / SMSS / SMG, right? It did in terms of playstyle and functionality, but then they took the game and made it so horribly simplistic that it's hard to enjoy it at all. Mario games were never hard, but they had places that'd kick your ass for a bit, and they had some small amount of challenge, while Odyssey is just a hollow Easter egg hunt. It feeds off of the completionist in you, while older Mario games were fun just through their gameplay. 

In short, older Mario games actually felt like a game, while Odyssey feels like a cheap sandbox with Easter eggs to find.

Now, Zelda... I grew up on Zelda, and it's always been my favorite game series -- I even learned to read by playing Zelda way back when. BOTW just isn't a Zelda game. It's a watered down survival sandbox with a Zelda skin on it, and a vague story behind it that really means nothing 90% of the time. Zelda games are known for exploration, story, and progression with new items and whatnot. BOTW has one of those three, and the exploration is samey and boring. Nintendo wanted to go back to Zelda 1 (for what reason I don't know, since LTTP was infinitely more popular), but then took out half the things from Zelda 1 that made it a Zelda game. It's pretty, but that's about all the game has.

So, as a Zelda game it's a failure. As a spinoff or standalone game it's just boring and shallow.

Though I really don't expect people to look at things critically. A lot of "gamers" today weren't alive in the golden age of gaming, when you could actually look forward to things. Most people nowadays just see a pretty game and ignore everything else.
